marketNews.title: Himbara Raise US Dollar Deposit Rates to 4%
marketNews.content: The state-owned bank group (Himbara) - consisting of Bank Rakyat Indonesia ($BBRI), Bank Mandiri ($BMRI), Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI), and Bank Tabungan Negara ($BBTN) - announced on Wednesday (24/9) that they will increase the counter rate for US dollar-denominated deposits to 4% per annum effective November 5, 2025. This increase applies to all balance categories and all tenors up to 12 months. This move follows the statement by the Minister of Finance, Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, who said on Friday (19/9) that the government is preparing market-based incentives to encourage fund owners to prefer placing their US dollar deposits domestically. These incentives are expected to strengthen national foreign exchange reserves, increase the supply of US dollars in banking, and facilitate the financing needs of strategic government projects. This policy is expected to support the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar, which depreciated again to 16,676 per Wednesday (24/9), marking the weakest level since April 2025. The weakening of the rupiah over the past week was primarily caused by negative sentiment related to the issues of: 1) weakening Bank Indonesia independence; and 2) the potential increase in government debt (deficit) to boost economic growth. Meanwhile, the Deposit Insurance Corporation lowered the maximum guaranteed interest rate for foreign currency (forex) deposits in conventional banks by 25 bps to 2%, and lowered the maximum guaranteed interest rate for rupiah deposits in conventional banks by 25 bps to 3.5%. Key Takeaway: We assess that the potential impact of this decision will be limited (limited impact) on the overall cost of fund (CoF) of Himbara banks, considering: 1) the insignificant composition of US dollar deposits against total deposits; and 2) the effective CoF - based on 1H25 financial reports - which is already around the 4% range, except for BBTN. Meanwhile, based on OJK data, the average interest rate for forex deposits - which are mostly US dollars - is not far from the 4% level, with national private banks generally offering higher interest rates than Himbara.

marketNews.title: Head of the Fed, Jerome Powell, Tapped Expectations for Further Rate Cuts in the Coming Months
marketNews.content: Head of the Fed, Jerome Powell, on Tuesday (23/9) dismissed expectations for further rate cuts in the coming months, where he said that the committee is facing a challenging situation in deciding whether to prioritize inflation control or job protection. Powell's statement repeated his statement when the Fed cut interest rates last week, where Powell said that it is difficult to know what to do right now given that US inflation remains high while the labor market is weakening.

marketNews.title: Latest Consensus Survey by Bloomberg on Indonesian Economic Growth and BI Rate
marketNews.content: The latest consensus surveyed by Bloomberg in September 2025 expects Bank Indonesia to cut the BI Rate by another 25 bps until the end of 2025 to the level of 4.5%, following the unexpected 25 bps BI Rate cut to the level of 4.75% in September 2025. The consensus also expects the Indonesian economy to grow +4.9% YoY in 2025 (vs. 2024: +5.03% YoY), slightly higher than the consensus expectation in the previous August 2025 survey at +4.85% YoY and in line with the 2025 State Budget outlook which expects economic growth around +4.7-5% YoY. For 2026, the consensus expects Indonesian economic growth to only grow +4.9% YoY, unchanged from the previous survey and lower than the 2026 State Budget target of +5.4% YoY.

marketNews.title: OECD Revises Indonesia's Economic Growth Projection Upwards
marketNews.content: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) on Tuesday (23/9) revised Indonesia's economic growth projection to +4.9% YoY in 2025 and +4.9% YoY in 2026, higher than the previous outlook in June 2025 at +4.7% YoY in 2025 and +4.8% YoY in 2026, although slightly lower than the 2024 realization of +5.03% YoY. OECD assessed that Indonesia's economic growth will be supported by "monetary policy easing and strong public investment." Furthermore, OECD also revised upwards the global economic growth projection for 2025 by +0.3 percentage point to +3.2% YoY (vs. 2024: +3.3% YoY), while the projection for 2026 remained unchanged at +2.9%.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Palm Oil Exports and Stocks in July 2025
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Palm Oil Producers Association noted that Indonesian palm oil exports fell -1.9% MoM in July 2025 to approximately 3.54 million tons, with stocks rising +1.5% MoM to approximately 2.57 million tons. Palm oil production increased +6% MoM in July 2025, while domestic consumption fell -1.8% MoM along with a decrease in biodiesel consumption of -2.7% MoM.

marketNews.title: European Commission Plans to Delay Anti-Deforestation Regulation Implementation Again
marketNews.content: The European Commission on Tuesday (23/9) plans to again postpone the implementation of the anti-deforestation regulation for another 1 year until December 30, 2026, citing information technology issues and supply chain concerns. This postponement plan still requires approval from EU member states and the European Parliament. Previously, the European Commission in October 2024 had postponed the implementation of the anti-deforestation regulation for 1 year until December 30, 2025. The European Union's anti-deforestation regulation requires due diligence requirements for a number of commodities and their derivatives entering the region, including palm oil, cattle, soybeans, coffee, cocoa, as well as wood and rubber products.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's Pulp and Paper Exports Show Strong Growth Until July 2025
marketNews.content: The General Chairman of the Indonesian Pulp and Paper Association, Liana Bratasida, told Kontan on Tuesday (23/9) that Indonesian pulp exports in the 7M25 period surged +13.1% YoY to 3.8 million tons, while paper exports increased +15% YoY to 3.4 million tons.

marketNews.title: PT Manulife Aset Manajemen Indonesia Announces Acquisition of PT Schroder Investment Management Indonesia
marketNews.content: PT Manulife Aset Manajemen Indonesia announced it will acquire PT Schroder Investment Management Indonesia. This transaction is expected to be completed after all specified closing conditions are met. Until the acquisition process is fully completed, PT Manulife Aset Manajemen Indonesia and Schroder Indonesia will continue to operate independently and maintain full compliance with all applicable regulations.

tickerNews.title: SSMS Plans to Acquire 63.4% Stake in PT Sawit Mandiri Lestari for IDR 1.6 Trillion
tickerNews.content: $SSMS: Sawit Sumbermas Sarana plans to acquire a 63.4% stake in PT Sawit Mandiri Lestari worth 1.6 trillion rupiah from the company's controller, PT Citra Borneo Indah. PT Sawit Mandiri Lestari is a palm oil plantation company that has commercially operated in Central Kalimantan with an area of 11,046 hectares. SSMS explained that this transaction plan considers the location of PT Sawit Mandiri Lestari's plantation which is in the same area as the company and has young crop age, so this transaction plan can increase the company's productivity. This plan will be discussed in an Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (EGMS) on October 30, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Petrosea Board Members Purchased Shares of PTRO
tickerNews.content: $PTRO: Supervisory board members and directors of Petrosea - Erwin Ciputra and Kartika Hendrawan - purchased 1 million and 200 thousand PTRO shares respectively at a price of 5,425 rupiah per share and 5,675 rupiah per share on September 22-23, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 6.6 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Erwin Ciputra's ownership in PTRO increased from 0.0898% to 0.0997%, while Kartika Hendrawan's ownership increased from 0.0172% to 0.0192%.

tickerNews.title: Astra Agro Lestari to Distribute Interim Dividend for 2025 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: $AALI: Astra Agro Lestari announced it will distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to 236.7 billion rupiah or 123 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of ~1.6% as of Wednesday (24/9). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is October 2, 2025, while payment is scheduled for October 24, 2025.

tickerNews.title: PT Tunggal Jaya Investama Reduced its Stake in IMPC via Repurchase Agreement
tickerNews.content: $IMPC: PT Tunggal Jaya Investama transferred 1.67 billion (3.04%) shares of Impack Pratama Industri at an average price of 650 rupiah per share on September 23, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.1 trillion rupiah and was intended as a repurchase agreement (repo). After this transaction, PT Tunggal Jaya Investama's ownership in IMPC decreased from 42.15% to 39.11%.

tickerNews.title: Suparma Announces Stock Dividend for 2024 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: $SPMA: Suparma announced it will distribute a stock dividend for the 2024 fiscal year at a ratio of 100:30. The maximum number of shares to be distributed reaches 946.2 million shares, equivalent to 378.5 billion rupiah from the unreserved retained earnings capital. The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is November 7, 2025, while the stock dividend distribution date is November 25, 2025.
